This game is a good game don't get me wrong. I really enjoy it most of the time but there are times where it feels like its a no win situation as a survivor, like not matter what you do you're gonna lose. It feels like the devs give the killers too much power (ex. they are faster than you, even if you vault through a window they will still manage to catch up to you). I'm not hating on the game, it is very good. But when moments like those happen it makes it less fun to play. I'm not trying to complain, "Oh the killers are too overpowered, I want an easy win." But sometimes it does feel like they're a little overpowered and it makes the game less enjoyable for at least the survivors. Killers gotta kill I get that, but I feel they have it a little too easy sometimes.

It's true that customers are slow to compliment and quick to complain. Because of that, I wait until I've experienced a product for a significant amount of time. While this is a negative review, I would like to point out that this game has its days where it can be fun, Those days, however, have grown increasingly few and far between. Here are some of the things that have ruined my experience in this game: 1. The matching system for survivors appears to be poorly designed to a point where I usually only get killers of a higher caliber than what players of my skill level can fairly handle (this is irrespective of whether or not I am paired with  a higher raking survivor in SWF). 2. Regardless of the fact that I pair myself with players from the same region, I have attained evidence in the form of relatable experience that fellow players experience mysterious lag spikes- which interfere in normal gameplay in a significant way (usually to the detriment of the survivor). 3. The sheer amount of toxicity that can be witnessed in this game is comparable only to League of Legends, ad there are almost no discernible consequences for those who choose to verbally assault other players in the after game chat. Forget the fact  that a certain amount of that is to be expected. It simply points to the lack of organization and detail found in the game. The only reason that I still play is to have something to do while my other games update.

Skins are $14 and the game is broken

no but REAL TALK, how is the game still this broken? Every match I want to disconnect. Solo play (from which the game is balanced around) is very poorly designed and the community is extremely toxic. They will think a cross-air on your monitor and using NVIDIA filters is cheating when they use discord, an unintended third party app to get an advantage on killer. Do yourself a favor and avoid this like the Plague.
don't

It's fun in private lobbies when you're just hanging out with friends but public matches are heavily mixed. Usually if you're having fun someone else isn't. Also I don't understand why this game has a ranking system when it is so unbalanced. Also it's ridiculously grindy. Overall don't get it, it's a heavily mixed bag where the bad currently outweighs the good. Could be worth looking into later.

Various perks, play styles, the "Skill-Based MMR," and even the ineptitude of the developers themselves encourage toxicity and scummy play that make the game an exercise in frustration. This game is not fair, bottom line, cut and dry, but it can also be enjoyable at times especially if you're playing with friends. Anyone who wants to play this game should do so with caution.

Also BHVR has NFT shills so fuck them for that too.
